<description type="note">Title: The woman taken in adultery.
Genre: English mystery and miracle plays.

Hic de muliere in adulterio deprehensa. Nolo mortem peccatoris. Jhesus Man for Ã¾i synne take repentaunce If Ã¾ou amende Ã¾at is amys Than hevyn xal be Ã¾in herytaunce Thow Ã¾ou haue don A?ens god grevauns ?ett mercy to haske loke Ã¾ou be bolde his mercy doth passe in trewe balauns All cruel jugement be many folde. thow Ã¾at ?our synnys be nevyr so grett Ffor hem be sad and aske mercy sone of my ffadyr grace ?e may gett with Ã¾e leste teer wepynge owte of ?our ey My ffadyr me sent the man to bye All Ã¾i Raunsom my-sylfe must pay Ffor loue of Ã¾e my-sylfe wyl dye Iff Ã¾ou aske mercy I sey nevyr nay. In to Ã¾e erth ffrom hevyn A-bove Ã¾i sorwe to sese and joye to restore man I cam down all ffor Ã¾i loue Loue me ageyn I aske no more Ã¾ow Ã¾ou mys-happe and synne ful sore ?it turne A?en and mercy craue it is Ã¾i fawte and Ã¾ou be lore haske Ã¾ou mercy and Ã¾ou xalt haue. Vppon Ã¾i neybore be not vengabyl Ageyn Ã¾e lawe if he offende lyke as he is Ã¾ou art vnstabyl thyn owyn frelte evyr Ã¾ou attende Euer more Ã¾i neybore helpe to Amende evyn as Ã¾ou woldyst he xulde Ã¾e Ageyn hym wrath if Ã¾ou accende the same in happ wyll falle on the. Eche man to othyr be mercyable And mercy he xal haue at nede What man of mercy is not tretable Whan he Askyth mercy he xal not spede Mercy to graunt I com in dede Who so Aske mercy he xal haue grace Lett no man dowte for his mysdede But evyr Aske mercy whyl he hath space. Scriba Alas Alas oure Lawe is lorn A fals Ypocryte jhesu be name Ã¾at of a sheppherdis dowtyr was born Wyl breke oure lawe and make it lame he wyl us werke ryght mekyl shame his fals purpos if he up-holde all oure lawys he doth defame Ã¾at Stynkynge beggere is woundyr bolde. Phariseus Sere scrybe in feyth Ã¾at ypocryte wyl turne Ã¾is londe al to his lore Ã¾erfore I councell hym to indyte And chastyse hym ryght wel Ã¾erfore. Scriba On hym be-leve many A score In his prechynge he is so gay Ech man hym ffolwygh ever more and more A?ens Ã¾at he seyth no man seyth nay. Phariseus A Ffals qwarel if we cowde feyne Ã¾at ypocrite to puttyn in blame All his prechynge xulde sone disteyne and than his wurchepp xuld turne to shame with sum falshede to spyllyn his name lett vs assay his lore to spylle Ã¾e pepyl with hym yff we cowde grame than xulde we sone haue al oure wyll. Accusator Herke sere pharysew and sere scrybe A ryght good sporte I kan ?ow telle I vndyr-take Ã¾at ryght a good brybe We all xul haue to kepe councell A fayre ?onge qwene here-by doth dwelle both ffiesch and gay upon to loke And a tall man with here doth melle the wey in to hyre chawmere ryght evyn he toke. lett us thre now go streyte thedyr the wey fful evyn I xall ?ow lede and we xul take them both to-gedyr Whyll Ã¾at Ã¾ei do Ã¾at synful dede. Scriba Art Ã¾ou sekyr Ã¾at we xal spede Shall we hym fynde whan we cum there. Accusator be my trowth I haue no drede Ã¾e hare fro Ã¾e fforme we xal a-rere. Phariseus We xal haue game and Ã¾is be trewe lete us thre werke by on Assent We wyl here brynge evyn be-forn jhesu and of here lyff Ã¾e truth present How in advowtrye hyre lyff is lent Than hym be-forn whan she is browth We xul hym Aske Ã¾e trew jugement What lawfull deth to here is wrouth. Of grace and mercy hevyr he doth preche And Ã¾at no man xulde be vengeable Ageyn Ã¾e woman if he sey wrech Than of his prechynge he is vnstable And if we fynde hym varyable of his prechynge Ã¾at he hath tawth than haue we cawse bothe juste and Able Ffor a fals man Ã¾at he be cawth. Scriba Now be grete god ?e sey fful well If we hym fyndyn in varyaunce We haue good reson as ?e do tell Hym for to brynge to foule myschauns If he holde stylle his dalyauns and preche of mercy hire for to saue than haue we mater of gret substauns hym for to kylle and putt in graue. Grett reson why I xal ?ow telle Ffor moyses doth bydde in oure lawe that Euery Advowterere we xuld qwelle and ?itt with stonys thei xulde be slawe Ageyn moyses if Ã¾at he drawe Ã¾at Synful woman with grace to helpe he xal nevyr skape out of oure Awe but he xal dye lyke a dogge whelpe. Accusator ?e tary ovyr longe serys I sey ?ow they wyl sone parte as Ã¾at I gesse Ã¾erfore if ?e wyl haue ?our pray now lete us go take them in here whantownnesse. Phariseus Goo Ã¾ou be-forn Ã¾e wey to dresse We xal Ã¾e ffolwe with-in short whyle Iff Ã¾at we may Ã¾at quene dystresse I hope we xal jhesu be-gyle. Scriba Breke up Ã¾e dore and go we inne Sett to Ã¾e shuldyr with all Ã¾i myght We xal hem take evyn in here synne here owyn trespas shal Ã¾em indite. hic juuenis quidam extra currit indeploydo calligis non ligatis et braccas in manu tenens et dicit accusator Accusator Stow Ã¾at harlot sum erthely wyght that in advowtrye here is ffownde. Juuenis ?iff Any man stow me Ã¾is nyth I xal hym ?eve a dedly wownde. I Any man my wey doth stoppe or we departe ded xal I be I xal Ã¾is daggare putt in his croppe I xal hym kylle or he xal me. Phariseus Grett goddys curse mut go with the With suche a shrewe wyll I not melle. Juuenes That same blyssynge I ?yff ?ow thre And qwheth ?ow alle to Ã¾e devyl of helle. In feyth I was so sore affrayd Of ?one thre shrewys Ã¾e sothe to say my breche be nott ?ett well up-teyd I had such hast to renne A-way Thei xal nevyr cacche me in such affray I am full glad Ã¾at I am gon Adewe Adewe a xxt i devyl way and goddys curse haue ?e every-chon. Scriba Come forth Ã¾ou stotte com forth Ã¾ou scowte com forth Ã¾ou bysmare and brothel bolde com forth Ã¾ou hore and stynkynge bych clowte how longe hast Ã¾ou such harlotry holde. Phariseus Com forth Ã¾ou quene com forth Ã¾ou scolde com forth Ã¾ou sloveyn com forth Ã¾ou slutte we xal the tecche with carys colde A lytyl bettyr to kepe Ã¾i kutte. Mulyer A mercy mercy serys I ?ow pray Ffor goddys loue haue mercy on me of my mys-levynge me not be-wray haue mercy on me for charyte. Accusator Aske us no mercy it xal not be We xul so ordeyn ffor Ã¾i lott Ã¾at Ã¾ou xalt dye for Ã¾in Advowtrye Ãerfore com forth Ã¾ou stynkynge stott. Mulier Serys my wurchepp if ?e wyl saue And helpe I haue non opyn shame bothe gold and sylvyr ?e xul haue So Ã¾at in clennes ?e kepe my name. Scriba Mede ffor to take we were to blame to save suche stottys it xal not be We xal brynge the to suche a game Ã¾at all advowtererys xul lern be the. Mulier Stondynge ?e wyl not graunt me grace but for my synne Ã¾at I xal dye I pray ?ow kylle me here in Ã¾is place and lete not Ã¾e pepyl up-on me crye If I be sclaundryd opynly to all my frendys it xul be shame I pray ?ow kylle me prevyly lete not Ã¾e pepyl know my defame. Phariseus Ffy on Ã¾e scowte Ã¾e devyl Ã¾e qwelle Ageyn Ã¾e lawe xul we Ã¾e kyll Ffyrst xal hange Ã¾e Ã¾e devyl of helle or we such folyes xulde ffulfyll thow it lyke Ã¾e nevyr so ill be-fforn Ã¾e prophete Ã¾ou xalt haue lawe lyke as moyse doth charge ut tyll With grett stonys Ã¾ou xalt be slawe. Accusator Com forth a-pase Ã¾ou stynkynge scowte be-fore Ã¾e prophete Ã¾ou were Ã¾is day or I xal ?eue Ã¾e such a clowte Ã¾at Ã¾ou xalt fall down evyn in Ã¾e way. Scriba now be grett god and I Ã¾e pay Such a buffett I xal Ã¾e take Ã¾at all Ã¾e teth I dare wel say with-inne Ã¾in heed ffor who xul shake. Phariseus Herke sere prophete we all ?ow pray to gyff trewe dom and just sentence Vpon Ã¾is woman which Ã¾is same day In synfull advowtery hath don offense. hic ihesus dum isti accusant mulierem continue debet digito suo scribere in terra. Accusator Se we haue brought here to ?our presens be-cawse ?e ben a wyse prophete Ã¾at ?e xal telle be consyens What deth to hyre ?e thynke most mete. Scriba In moyses lawe ryght Ã¾us we fynde Ã¾at such fals louers xul be slayn streyte to a stake we xul hem bynde and with grett stonys brest out Ã¾er brayn Of ?our concyens telle us Ã¾e playn with Ã¾is woman what xal be wrought Shall we lete here go qwyte agayn or to hire deth xal she be brought. Jhesus nichil respondit sed semper scrybyt in terra. Mulier Now holy prophete be mercyable vpon me wrecch take no vengeaunce Ffor my synnys Abhomynable In hert I haue grett repentaunce I am wel wurthy to haue myschaunce Both bodyly deth and werdly shame but gracyous prophete of socurraunce Ã¾is tyme pray ?ow for goddys name. Phariseus Ageyn Ã¾e lawe Ã¾ou dedyst offens Ã¾erfore of grace speke Ã¾ou no more As moyses gevyth in law sentens Ã¾ou xalt be stonyd to deth Ã¾er-fore. Accusator Ha don sere prophete telle us ?oure lore xul we Ã¾is woman with stonys kyll or to hire hous hire home restore In Ã¾is mater tell us ?our wyll. Scriba In a colde stodye me thynkyth ?e sytt good sere awake telle us ?our thought xal she be stonyd telle us ?our wytt or in what rewle xal sche be brought. Jhesus Loke which of ?ow Ã¾at nevyr synne wrought but is of lyff clennere Ã¾an she Cast at here stonys and spare here nowght Clene out of synne if Ã¾at ?e be. hic ihesus iterum se inclinans scribet in terra et omnes accusatores quasi confusi separatim in tribus locis se disiungent,' Phariseus Alas Alas I am ashamyd I am a-fferde Ã¾at I xal deye all myn synnys evyn propyrly namyd ?on prophyte dede wryte be-for myn eye Iff Ã¾at my felawys Ã¾at dude Aspye they wyll telle it bothe ffer and wyde my synfull levynge if Ã¾ei out crye I wot nevyr wher myn heed to hyde. Accusator Alas for sorwe myn herte doth blede All my synnes ?on man dude wryte If Ã¾at my felawys to them toke hede I kan not me ffrom deth Acquyte I wolde I wore hyd sum-where out of syght Ã¾at men xuld me no-where se ne knowe Iff I be take I am afflyght In mekyl shame I xal be throwe. Scriba Alas Ã¾e tyme Ã¾at Ã¾is be-tyd Ryght byttyr care doth me enbrace All my synnys be now vnhyd ?on man be-for me hem all doth trace If I were onys out of Ã¾is place to suffyr deth gret and vengeauns Able I wyl nevyr come be-for his face Ã¾ow I xuld dye in a stable. Mulier Thow I be wurthy ffor my trespas to suffyr deth ab-homynable ?itt holy prophete of ?our hy? grace In ?our jugement be mercyable I wyl nevyr more be so vnstable O holy prophete graunt me mercy of myn synnys vnresonable With all myn hert I am sory. Jhesus Where be Ã¾i fomen Ã¾at dude Ã¾e Accuse Why haue Ã¾ei left us to Alone. Mulier By-cawse they cowde nat hemself excuse With shame they ffled hens Euery-chone But gracyous prophete lyst to my mone of my sorwe take compassyon now all myn enmyes hens be gone Sey me sum wurde of consolacion. Jhesus Ffor Ã¾o synnys Ã¾at Ã¾ou hast wrought hath Any man condempnyd the. Mulier Nay for-soth Ã¾at hath Ã¾er nought but in ?our grace I putt me. Jhesus Ffor me Ã¾ou xalt nat condempnyd be go hom A-geyn and walk at large loke Ã¾at Ã¾ou leve in honeste and wyl no more to synne I Ã¾e charge. Mulier I thanke ?ow hy?ly holy prophete Of Ã¾is grett grace ?e haue me graunt all my lewde lyff I xal doun lete and ffonde to be goddys trewe servaunt. Jhesus What man of synne be repentaunt of god if he wyl mercy craue God of mercy is so habundawnt Ã¾at what man haske it he xal it haue. Whan man is contrite and hath wonne grace God wele not kepe olde wreth in mynde but bettyr loue to hem he has Very contryte whan he them fynde Now god Ã¾at dyed ffor all mankende saue all Ã¾ese pepyl both nyght and day and of oure synnys he us vnbynde hy?e lorde of hevyn Ã¾at best may.
